title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement Eric R. Scott. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Basic usage of azmetr
text: retrieve recent day data stations simply calling az_daily() az_hourly() without arguments. az_daily() retrieves daily summary data az_hourly() retrieves hourly data.
code: daily <- az_daily() #> Querying data from 2024-06-23 #> Returning data from 2024-06-23 hourly <- az_hourly() #> Querying most recent hour of data #> Returning data from 2024-06-24 09:00 head(daily) #> # A tibble: 6 × 75 #>   meta_bat_volt_max meta_bat_volt_mean meta_bat_volt_min meta_needs_review #>               <dbl>              <dbl>             <dbl>             <dbl> #> 1              13.9               13.2              12.8                 0 #> 2              13.8               13.0              12.6                 0 #> 3              14.4               13.0              12.6                 0 #> 4              13.7               13.0              12.6                 0 #> 5              13.9               13.1              12.7                 0 #> 6              13.6               13.0              12.7                 0 #> # ℹ 71 more variables: meta_station_id <chr>, meta_station_name <chr>, #> #   meta_version <dbl>, chill_hours_0C <dbl>, chill_hours_20C <dbl>, #> #   chill_hours_32F <dbl>, chill_hours_45F <dbl>, chill_hours_68F <dbl>, #> #   chill_hours_7C <dbl>, date_doy <dbl>, date_year <dbl>, datetime <date>, #> #   dwpt_mean <dbl>, dwpt_meanF <dbl>, eto_azmet <dbl>, eto_azmet_in <dbl>, #> #   eto_pen_mon <dbl>, eto_pen_mon_in <dbl>, heat_units_10C <dbl>, #> #   heat_units_13C <dbl>, heat_units_3413C <dbl>, heat_units_45F <dbl>, … head(hourly) #> # A tibble: 6 × 42 #>   meta_bat_volt meta_needs_review meta_station_id meta_station_name meta_version #>           <dbl>             <dbl> <chr>           <chr>                    <dbl> #> 1          13.7                 0 az01            Tucson                       1 #> 2          13.5                 0 az02            Yuma Valley                  1 #> 3          13.3                 0 az04            Safford                      1 #> 4          13.2                 0 az05            Coolidge                     1 #> 5          13.4                 0 az06            Maricopa                     1 #> 6          12.9                 0 az07            Aguila                       1 #> # ℹ 37 more variables: date_datetime <dttm>, date_doy <dbl>, date_hour <chr>, #> #   date_year <dbl>, dwpt <dbl>, dwptF <dbl>, eto_azmet <dbl>, #> #   eto_azmet_in <dbl>, heatstress_cottonC <dbl>, heatstress_cottonF <dbl>, #> #   precip_total <dbl>, precip_total_in <dbl>, relative_humidity <dbl>, #> #   sol_rad_total <dbl>, sol_rad_total_ly <dbl>, temp_airC <dbl>, #> #   temp_airF <dbl>, temp_soil_10cmC <dbl>, temp_soil_10cmF <dbl>, #> #   temp_soil_50cmC <dbl>, temp_soil_50cmF <dbl>, vp_actual <dbl>, …

title: Basic usage of azmetr
text: supplying start_date az_daily() start_date_time az_hourly() can retrieve data going back time. specify end date, use end_date end_date_time. must also supply start date supply end date. Note dates datetimes can supplied character values year, month, day order can supplied Date POSIXct vectors. supplied date precise data, rounded . az_daily() datetimes rounded nearest day az_hourly() datetimes rounded nearest hour.
code: last_date <- max(daily$datetime) last_date #> [1] "2024-06-23" last_week <- last_date - lubridate::weeks(1) wk <- az_daily(start_date = last_week) #> Querying data from 2024-06-16 through 2024-06-23 #> Warning in az_daily(start_date = last_week): Some requested data were #> unavailable #> Returning data from 2024-06-16 through 2024-06-23 range(wk$datetime) #> [1] "2024-06-16" "2024-06-23" last_datetime <- max(hourly$date_datetime) last_datetime #> [1] "2024-06-24 09:00:00 MST" last_48h <- last_datetime - hours(48) hr <- az_hourly(start_date_time = last_48h) #> Querying data from 2024-06-22 09:00 through 2024-06-24 09:00 #> Returning data from 2024-06-22 09:00 through 2024-06-24 09:00 range(hr$date_datetime) #> [1] "2024-06-22 09:00:00 MST" "2024-06-24 09:00:00 MST" daily_range <- az_daily(start_date = "2022-01-01", end_date = "2022-01-05") #> Querying data from 2022-01-01 through 2022-01-05 #> Returning data from 2022-01-01 through 2022-01-05 range(daily_range$datetime) #> [1] "2022-01-01" "2022-01-05" char_daily <- az_daily(start_date = "2023-01-10 12:43:22", end_date = "2023-01-11 15:00:01") #> Querying data from 2023-01-10 through 2023-01-11 #> Returning data from 2023-01-10 through 2023-01-11 range(char_daily$datetime) #> [1] "2023-01-10" "2023-01-11" char_hourly <- az_hourly(start_date = "2023-01-10 12:43:22", end_date = "2023-01-11 15:00:01") #> Querying data from 2023-01-10 12:43 through 2023-01-11 15:00 #> Warning in az_hourly(start_date = "2023-01-10 12:43:22", end_date = "2023-01-11 #> 15:00:01"): You requested data through 2023-01-11 15:00:00 but only data #> through 2023-01-11 14:00:00 were available #> Returning data from 2023-01-10 13:00 through 2023-01-11 14:00 range(char_hourly$date_datetime) #> [1] "2023-01-10 13:00:00 MST" "2023-01-11 14:00:00 MST"

title: Basic usage of azmetr
text: Information stations available contained station_info dataset including station name, station ID, location. need data subset stations, can supply station_id. However, note query API per station due limitations API works. may faster just get data stations subset since queries web API results identical dataset.
code: station_info #> # A tibble: 30 × 5 #>    meta_station_name meta_station_id latitude longitude elev_m #>    <chr>             <chr>              <dbl>     <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1 Tucson            az01                32.3     -111.    717 #>  2 Yuma Valley       az02                32.7     -115.     36 #>  3 Safford           az04                32.8     -110.    903 #>  4 Coolidge          az05                33.0     -112.    423 #>  5 Maricopa          az06                33.1     -112.    362 #>  6 Aguila            az07                33.9     -113.    657 #>  7 Parker            az08                34.0     -114.     98 #>  8 Bonita            az09                32.5     -110.   1349 #>  9 Phoenix Greenway  az12                33.6     -112.    403 #> 10 Yuma N.Gila       az14                32.8     -115.     43 #> # ℹ 20 more rows system.time(   sub_wk <- az_daily(station_id = c(1, 2, 8), start_date = "2022-01-01", end_date = "2022-01-15") ) #> Querying data from 2022-01-01 through 2022-01-15 #> Returning data from 2022-01-01 through 2022-01-15 #>    user  system elapsed  #>   0.104   0.004   1.003 system.time(   sub_wk2 <- subset(     az_daily(start_date = "2022-01-01", end_date = "2022-01-15"),     meta_station_id %in% c("az01", "az02", "az08")   ) ) #> Querying data from 2022-01-01 through 2022-01-15 #> Returning data from 2022-01-01 through 2022-01-15 #>    user  system elapsed  #>   0.396   0.000   1.041 all(sub_wk2 == sub_wk) #> [1] NA

title: Using azmetr with the units package
text: can add correct units data returned az_daily(), az_hourly(), az_heat() passing resulting tibble az_add_units(). requires units package installed prompt don’t installed. may also helpful explicitly load package library(units) resulting tibble displays units correctly.
code: hourly <-    az_hourly() %>%    az_add_units()  #> Querying most recent hour of data #> Returning data from 2024-06-24 09:00 hourly %>%    select(-starts_with("meta_"), -starts_with("date_")) %>%    head() #> # A tibble: 6 × 33 #>   dwpt  dwptF eto_azmet eto_azmet_in heatstress_cottonC heatstress_cottonF #>   [°C] [degF]      [mm]         [in]               [°C]             [degF] #> 1 19.7   67.5       0.4         0.02               28.4               83.2 #> 2 18.3   65         0.5         0.02               29.2               84.6 #> 3 18.6   65.6       0.2         0.01               26.1               79   #> 4 19.4   67         0.5         0.02               30.2               86.3 #> 5 18.6   65.4       0.5         0.02               30.4               86.8 #> 6 18.4   65.2       0.5         0.02               29.1               84.4 #> # ℹ 27 more variables: precip_total [mm], precip_total_in [in], #> #   relative_humidity [%], sol_rad_total [MJ/m^2], sol_rad_total_ly [langleys], #> #   temp_airC [°C], temp_airF [degF], temp_soil_10cmC [°C], #> #   temp_soil_10cmF [degF], temp_soil_50cmC [°C], temp_soil_50cmF [degF], #> #   vp_actual [kPa], vp_deficit [kPa], wind_2min_spd_max_mph [miles/h], #> #   wind_2min_spd_max_mps [m/s], wind_2min_spd_mean_mph [miles/h], #> #   wind_2min_spd_mean_mps [m/s], wind_2min_timestamp <dttm>, …

title: Using azmetr with the units package
text: az_add_units() converts numeric vectors class “units”. units columns behave differently ordinary numeric vectors useful properties. First, can unit conversion using set_units() units package. Second, won’t allow math units aren’t compatible. also means generally add subtract unitless constants.
code: hourly %>%    transmute(wind_spd_kph = set_units(wind_spd_mps, "km/h"),             sol_rad_total = set_units(sol_rad_total, "W h m-2"),             temp_airK = set_units(temp_airF, "Kelvins")) #> # A tibble: 31 × 3 #>    wind_spd_kph sol_rad_total temp_airK #>          [km/h]     [h*W/m^2]       [K] #>  1         4.32          503.      304. #>  2        13.0           469.      306. #>  3         3.96          353.      301. #>  4         7.92          547.      307. #>  5         6.48          522.      308. #>  6         7.2           542.      306. #>  7        10.1           403.      305. #>  8         1.44          236.      296. #>  9         3.24          369.      308. #> 10         1.8           486.      307. #> # ℹ 21 more rows hourly %>%     transmute(wind_rain = wind_spd_mps + precip_total) #> Error in `transmute()`: #> ℹ In argument: `wind_rain = wind_spd_mps + precip_total`. #> Caused by error: #> ! cannot convert mm into m/s ## This will error: # hourly$wind_spd_mps[1] + 10  ## Must use: hourly$wind_spd_mps[1] + set_units(10, "m/s") #> 11.2 [m/s]

title: Using azmetr with the units package
text: units package works ggplot2 automatically include units axis labels.
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(hourly, aes(x = wind_spd_mps, y = sol_rad_total)) +   geom_point() +   labs(x = "wind speed",        y = "total solar radiation") #> Warning: The `scale_name` argument of `continuous_scale()` is deprecated as of ggplot2 #> 3.5.0. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated.

Assign units using the units package — az_add_units
text: x tibble output az_hourly(), az_daily(), az_heat()

title: Assign units using the units package — az_add_units
text: tibble columns class "units"

title: Assign units using the units package — az_add_units
code: if (FALSE) { daily <- az_daily()  daily_units <-   az_add_units(daily)  #unit conversions with `units::set_units()` daily_units$sol_rad_total %>% units::set_units("kW h m-2")  #units carry through calculations climatic_balance <-   daily_units$precip_total_mm - daily_units$eto_pen_mon climatic_balance }

what: Retrieve Daily Weather Data from AZMET — az_daily
title: Retrieve Daily Weather Data from AZMET — az_daily
text: Retrieves daily data Arizona Meteorological Network API. list weather stations locations see see station_info.

title: Retrieve Daily Weather Data from AZMET — az_daily
code: az_daily(station_id = NULL, start_date = NULL, end_date = NULL)

title: Retrieve Daily Weather Data from AZMET — az_daily
text: https://ag.arizona.edu/azmet/

title: Retrieve Daily Weather Data from AZMET — az_daily
text: station_id station ID can supplied numeric vector (e.g. station_id = c(8, 37)) character vector prefix "az" 2 digits (e.g. station_id = c("az08", "az37")) left blank data stations returned start_date length 1 vector class Date, POSIXct, character YYYY-MM-DD format.  rounded nearest day precision supplied. end_date length 1 vector class Date, POSIXct, character YYYY-MM-DD format.  rounded nearest day precision supplied.  Defaults current date left blank.

title: Retrieve Daily Weather Data from AZMET — az_daily
text: tibble. units metadata, see https://ag.arizona.edu/azmet/raw2003.htm

title: Retrieve Daily Weather Data from AZMET — az_daily
text: neither start_date end_date supplied, recent day data returned.  start_date supplied, end date defaults current date.  Supplying end_date result error.

title: Retrieve Daily Weather Data from AZMET — az_daily
text: station_id supplied vector, multiple successive calls API made.  may find better performance getting data stations leaving station_id blank subsetting resulting dataframe. Requests data stations 6-12 months may take considerable time.

title: Retrieve Daily Weather Data from AZMET — az_daily
code: if (FALSE) { # Most recent data for all stations: az_daily()  # Specify stations: az_daily(station_id = c(1, 2)) az_daily(station_id = c("az01", "az02"))  # Specify dates: az_daily(start_date = "2022-09-25") az_daily(start_date = "2022-09-25", end_date = "2022-09-26") }

what: Retrieve Accumulated Heat Units and Evapotranspiration — az_heat
title: Retrieve Accumulated Heat Units and Evapotranspiration — az_heat
text: Retrieves accumulated heat units reference evapotranspiration units Arizona Meteorological Network API.  default, returned values cumulative since January 1 current year. list weather stations locations see see station_info.

title: Retrieve Accumulated Heat Units and Evapotranspiration — az_heat
code: az_heat(station_id = NULL, start_date = NULL, end_date = NULL)

title: Retrieve Accumulated Heat Units and Evapotranspiration — az_heat
text: https://ag.arizona.edu/azmet/

title: Retrieve Accumulated Heat Units and Evapotranspiration — az_heat
text: station_id station ID can supplied numeric vector (e.g. station_id = c(8, 37)) character vector prefix "az" 2 digits (e.g. station_id = c("az08", "az37")) left blank data stations returned start_date length 1 vector class Date, POSIXct, character YYYY-MM-DD format.  rounded nearest day precision supplied. end_date length 1 vector class Date, POSIXct, character YYYY-MM-DD format.  rounded nearest day precision supplied.  Defaults current date left blank. end_date supplied, data cumulative start year end_date.

title: Retrieve Accumulated Heat Units and Evapotranspiration — az_heat
text: tibble. units metadata, see https://ag.arizona.edu/azmet/raw2003.htm

title: Retrieve Accumulated Heat Units and Evapotranspiration — az_heat
text: Unlike az_daily(), one row data per station returned, regardless start_date end_date. However, data returned cumulative time period specified start_date end_date.

title: Retrieve Accumulated Heat Units and Evapotranspiration — az_heat
text: station_id supplied vector, multiple successive calls API made.  may find better performance getting data stations leaving station_id blank subsetting resulting dataframe.

title: Retrieve Accumulated Heat Units and Evapotranspiration — az_heat
code: if (FALSE) { # Most recent data for all stations: az_heat()  # Specify stations: az_heat(station_id = c(1, 2)) az_heat(station_id = c("az01", "az02"))  # Specify dates: ## Cumulative since October 2022 az_heat(start_date = "2022-10-01")  ## Cumulative from the first of the year through March yr <- format(Sys.Date(), "%Y")  az_heat(end_date = paste(yr, "03", "31", sep = "-")) }

title: Retrieve Hourly Weather Data — az_hourly
text: Retrieves hourly weather data Arizona Meteorological Network API. list weather stations locations see see station_info.

title: Retrieve Hourly Weather Data — az_hourly
code: az_hourly(station_id = NULL, start_date_time = NULL, end_date_time = NULL)

title: Retrieve Hourly Weather Data — az_hourly
text: https://ag.arizona.edu/azmet/

title: Retrieve Hourly Weather Data — az_hourly
text: station_id station ID can supplied numeric vector (e.g. station_id = c(8, 37)) character vector prefix "az" 2 digits (e.g. station_id = c("az08", "az37")) left blank data stations returned start_date_time length 1 vector class POSIXct character YYYY-MM-DD HH format, AZ time.  rounded nearest hour precision supplied. date (YYYY-MM-DD) supplied, data requested starting 01:00:00 day end_date_time length 1 vector class POSIXct character YYYY-MM-DD HH format, AZ time.  rounded nearest hour precision supplied.  date (YYYY-MM-DD) supplied, data requested end day (23:59:59). Defaults current date time left blank start_date_time specified.

title: Retrieve Hourly Weather Data — az_hourly
text: tibble. units metadata, see https://ag.arizona.edu/azmet/raw2003.htm

title: Retrieve Hourly Weather Data — az_hourly
text: neither start_date_time end_date_time supplied, recent hour data returned.  start_date_time supplied, end_date_time defaults current time.  Supplying end_date_time result error.

title: Retrieve Hourly Weather Data — az_hourly
text: station_id supplied vector, multiple successive calls API made.  may find better performance getting data stations leaving station_id blank subsetting resulting dataframe. Requests data stations 10-15 days may take considerable time.

title: Retrieve Hourly Weather Data — az_hourly
code: if (FALSE) { # Most recent data for all stations: az_hourly()  # Specify stations: az_hourly(station_id = c(1, 2)) az_hourly(station_id = c("az01", "az02"))  # Specify dates: az_hourly(start_date_time = "2022-09-25 01") az_hourly(start_date_time = "2022-09-25 01", end_date = "2022-09-25 20") }

what: AZMet station names and locations — station_info
title: AZMet station names and locations — station_info
text: Station names, station IDs, location (lat, lon, elevation) active AZMet weather stations

title: AZMet station names and locations — station_info
AZMet station names and locations — station_info
text: tibble 30 rows 5 columns: meta_station_name Station name meta_station_id Station ID latitude, logitude Station location elev_m Station elevation meters

title: azmetr 0.3.0
text: az_hourly() now accepts dates start_date_time end_date_time Improved messages regarding date/time ranges queried returned data retrieval functions. az_hourly() now returns data previous hour start_date_time end_date_time supplied rather returning previous day hourly data. azmet now much verbose, printing messages data requested data returned. Added option "azmet.print_api_call" , set TRUE prints HTTP request sent API—debugging purposes. Fixed bug caused error data requested stations stations didn’t data variables. Requests data January 1, 2021 now error, since data AZMet API (yet).

title: azmetr 0.2.1
text: az_daily() az_hourly() now print warning missing data combination dates stations requested Transferred maintenance package Jeremy Weiss Timestamp hourly daily maximum two-minute sustained wind speeds, wind_2min_timestamp now appears downloaded data Variable type hourly daily wind_2min_timestamp now date-time instead character correct time zone, tzone = "America/Phoenix" Values hourly date_datetime variable now tzone = "America/Phoenix" assigned station_info dataset now includes elevation

title: azmetr 0.2.0
text: azmetr now uses httr2 package instead httr API requests. change allowed easier rate limiting now rate limit 4 requests per second API. shouldn’t cause noticeable slowdowns except using station_id argument maybe az_add_units() now adds units new wind_2min_* variables recently added API

title: azmetr 0.1.0
text: functions now check supplied station_id valid active station querying API added station_info dataset station names, IDs, location. az_daily() az_hourly() convert values like -999, -9999, etc. NAs functions now return 0x0 tibble data returned API changed internal use base R pipe (|>) magrittr pipe (%>%) instead requiring R 4.1 later exports magrittr pipe (%>%) can used loading azmetr can now supply POSIXct Date values start_date end_date arguments addition character ISO representations date (e.g. YYYY-MM-DD YYYY/MM/DD). can supply POSIXct start_date_time end_date_time. Additionally, can use character least (potentially ) precision hour. (e.g., YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS now works gets rounded nearest hour). added vignettes fixed bug wrong units added variables ending _mps az_add_units()

title: azmetr 0.0.0.9000
text: Functions accessing hourly (az_hourly()) daily (az_daily()) weather, cumulative heat units / ETO (az_heat()) added. Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
